channel.title: Epistemic Planning on Alessandro Burigana
channel.description: Recent content in Epistemic Planning on Alessandro Burigana

item.title: DELPHIC: Towards an Efficient Possibility-based Epistemic Planning Framework
item.description: The paper proposes a formulation of DEL-based epistemic planning based on a different kind of object, called possibility. OVERLAY 2022.

item.title: Multi-agent Epistemic Planning with Inconsistent Beliefs, Trust and Lies
item.description: This paper provides an epistemic planning framework for reasoning about inconsistent beliefs of agents, trust relations and lies. PRICAI 2021.

item.title: Modelling Multi-Agent Epistemic Planning in ASP
item.description: This paper explores the performances of an ASP model for epistemic planning called PLATO. ICLP, TPLP 2020.

item.title: EFP 2.0: A Multi-Agent Epistemic Solver with Multiple E-State Representations
item.description: This paper presents EFP 2.0, a multi-agent epistemic planner based on an alternative state representations called possibilities. ICAPS 2020.
